name: Vinland Saga
description: beautiful art and a main character who develops more in a couple hundred chapters then i ever will in my life. the covers and spines are also really cool and unique so they stand out a lot. hardcover copies also sell for only $30 so its not a bad price either, highly recommend.

name: 20th Century Boys
description: a really good mystery manga that just happens to have a really bad ending unless you read 21st century boys. the perfect edition is really good and definitely better then reading this through scans and the covers are really cool. not a fan of the fonts on the spine but i do like how the spines connect to make an image because i have a stupid monkey brain.

name: Annarasumanara
description: a really good and short manhwa with a pretty insane art style. there is a korean physical version so im holding out hope but it might just be too niche to get a english physical version.

name: Hinamatsuri
description: straight up most funny manga. one peace books (no relation to one piece) did a really good job especially considering ive never heard of them. sadly i also happen to not the cover and spines. the spines are really boring to look at and i just dont like the style the covers are drawn in.

name: One-Punch Man
description: funny and has really great art. viz as always did a good job on the actual manga part here. the covers are sick but the spines pretty boring and generic shoenen spines. id say its worth the buy and its pretty cheap by manga standards.

name: Hellper
description: one of the best manhwa and extremely underrated. currently has no english physical version but some guy on reddit said there would be at some point so it must be true. i really like the use of colour in hellper and looking at some of the korean physical versions the covers look sick.

name: The Boxer
description: one of the best manhwa ive ever read with fight scenes so good it feels like im the one being punched (in a good way). probably also the best physical manhwa ive ever read. it does a really good job of bringing the webtoon to a physical book and doesnt suffer from the same double spread issue i found in the horizion as the double spreads in this just work idk why im no artist.

name: The Horizon
description: the horizon is a brutal 21 chapters that i think anyone with a free afternoon should check out. i really like the covers and spines, not a big fan of how the big double page spreads come out in physical format though. i think reading it in the original webtoon format is the best experience but if you like it i think you should buy the physical copy as it just looks cool on a bookshelf. it is mad expensive though (almost 40 australian dollars) :(

name: JJBA Part 7: Steel Ball Run
description: peak jojo in one of the most bizzare adventures yet. gyro and johnny actually seem like real friends and they are really fun to watch. its a shame that somehow in more than 20 years there is still no offical english version of the highest rated jojo manga. how did this happen.

name: Girls' Last Tour
description: best post-apocalyptic manga with an awesome world and an ending that made me so sad i couldnt complete my IT work and failed the assignment. i really love the album covers and spines, my only gripe is that the circle around the number on the spine is too big and cuts off but thats pretty small. highly recommend buying the physical copy.

name: Your Lie in April
description: really good manga, made me cry. the translation is good but i dont really fw the cover and spine for the one either, the covers just kind of look bad in my eyes and i dont like the white spines either. good read just dont particularly recommend buying the physical manga, and its only about $10usd to read its offical copy online.

name: Goodnight Punpun
description: so good it broke my spirit and made me feel bad for like 2 days. viz as always did a really good job on punpun, great translations especially compared with the often shoddy fanmade ones, cool covers and colourschemes and another cool connecting spine image.

name: The Climber
description: 10/10 manga with the best ending ive ever read but somehow yet to have an offical english copy being sold to my knowledge. id love to buy one when it gets released but ive seen that the offical italian one is pretty bad so i dont have very high hopes.

name: Berserk
description: berserk is absoulte peak, it was so good everything post berserk seems worse. on the other hand the physical (deluxe edition at least) is just kinda boring. the actually manga is high quality, great translations and print quality but like 90% of the time i wont be looking at the manga and the all black doesnt really do it for me. i do like the texture though, id still buy it because berserk is peak though.

name: Dorohedoro
description: my favourite cast of characters and world in probably anything. they are all insane psychopaths who randomly kill anyone but are so charming they come off as just silly little guys. the world feels lived in and the characters dress up in insane outfits that youll only see in q hayashida's work. for sure recommend buying the physical and as with everything ive bought from viz the quality is very good. sadly after volume 3 the coloured pages stop being coloured? idk not a deal breaker but a bit disappointing.

name: Vagabond
description: peak character development, fights you cant predict the outcome of, genunine philosophy and straight up beautiful art, highly recommend. listenced by viz so its high qualitymm cool covers and i like thow the art on the spine connects, i really wanted the hardcover but they are just never in stock so i gave up :(.
